articles.summary: 10% of Meta's 2024 sales came from online ads promoting scams and banned goods. Google announced a deal with prediction market platforms Kalshi and Polymarket to integrate real-time market data into Google Finance. Miami-based Counterintuitive Corp is challenging Silicon Valley's approach to artificial intelligence. It has unveiled more than 80 patents for a new chip design called the Artificial Reasoning Unit (ARU). Cars.com has launched a conversational shopping engine called Carson AI.

articles.title: The best free AI for coding in 2025 - only 3 make the cut now
articles.author: ZDNet
articles.summary: I've been subjecting AI models to a set of real-world programming tests for over two years. This time, we look solely at the free offerings. There are three worth your attention. The others need work.      .

articles.title: Olson: Artificial Intelligence Saves Time But Needs Oversight'
articles.author: Shelley Byrne
articles.summary: Susan Olson, founder of Action Intel, talked about the use of artificial intelligence in the workplace during an online 'lunch and learn' session October 29. She used AI for research and writing assistance, marketing, predictive modeling, creating interactive tools to visualize data and assisting with computer coding. She also talked about ChatGPT and Claude, an AI chatbot developed by Anthropic.

articles.title: The AI spending frenzy is so huge that it makes no sense
articles.author: Shira Ovide
articles.summary: No one really knows if artificial intelligence is a bubble poised to burst or not, but the bros keep talking about it constantly. It's either/or. It doesn't matter either way, because it doesn't stop them from jabbering about it.

articles.title: China AI Dominance: Nvidia CEO Predicts Victory
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang believes China is destined to win the AI race. US restrictions on the sale of advanced Nvidia chips to China are having the opposite effect. China is investing heavily in its own semiconductor industry. China's AI application focus is a key differentiator.

articles.title: IBM CEO: Fears about AI bubble are overblown
articles.summary: Arvind Krishna, CEO of IBM, is at Citi's tech leadership summit in Pebble Beach, California. He joins CNBC's Sara Eisen to discuss how AI is impacting jobs, whether concerns around an AI bubble are warranted, and much more.

articles.title: Meta commits $600B in the U.S. by 2028 to support AI technology, infrastructure
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Meta is investing over $600B in the US by 2028 to support AI technology, infrastructure, and workforce expansion. Meta is also creating jobs, supporting local economies, and reinforcing America's technological leadership by building AI data centers in the U.S. Meta's investments are already having an impact.

articles.title: LumeFlow AI Launches AI Story Generation Tool for Consistent Long Video Creation
articles.author: Lume Flow AI
articles.summary: LumeFlow AI has announced the launch of its new feature: AI Story Generation. It transforms a simple idea into a complete, visually consistent, and engaging AI-generated story up to five minutes long. Early adopters have responded enthusiastically to this leap forward in long-form AI video creation.

articles.title: LumeFlow AI Launches AI Story Generation Tool for Consistent Long Video Creation
articles.author: Lumeflow Ai
articles.summary: LumeFlow AI has launched a new AI-generated video generation tool called AI Story Generation. It's designed for social media creators who want to create longer, cohesive videos up to five minutes in length. It transforms a simple idea into a complete, visually consistent, and engaging AI- generated story.

articles.title: LumeFlow AI Launches AI Story Generation Tool for Consistent Long Video Creation
articles.author: Lumeflow Ai
articles.summary: LumeFlow AI has announced the launch of its new feature: AI Story Generation. The AI Story Generator simplifies the once-complex process of creating long videos. It's built for social media creators seeking to produce longer, cohesive videos. LumeFlow's AI has become an essential tool for creators building monetizable, story-rich video content.

articles.title: Microsoft launches ‘superintelligence team' targeting medical diagnosis
articles.author: Nileena Sunil
articles.summary: Microsoft is forming a new team that would build artificial intelligence far more capable than humans in certain domains starting with medical diagnosis. This team, called the MAI Superintelligence Teams, follows similar projects by Meta, Safe Superintelligence, and other companies. Microsoft's AI chief in charge, Mustafa Suleyman, said the company plans to invest 'lots of money' and recruit famous AI talent.

articles.title: What Happens When Your Favorite Chatbot Dies?
articles.author: Time Magazine
articles.summary: In the Loop is a twice-weekly newsletter about AI. It will be published on Time.com and as emails. If you're reading this in your browser, why not subscribe to have the next one delivered straight to your inbox? Subscribe to In the Loop here.

articles.title: Millennials and Gen Z are using ChatGPT for legal advice: It's a bad idea, divorce lawyer says—here's why
articles.author: Gili Malinsky
articles.summary: 800 million people use ChatGPT chatbot every week, according to parent company OpenAI. Expert Vaile Wright warns against using chatbots for sensitive issues like therapy. Jackie Combs advises her clients to consult an attorney instead of a chatbot for legal advice.

articles.title: US to block Nvidia's sale of scaled-down AI chips to China
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: The White House has informed other federal agencies that it will not permit Nvidia to sell its latest scaled-down artificial intelligence (AI) chips to China. Nvidia has provided samples of the chip to several of its Chinese customers, according to The Information. The Information cites three people familiar with the matter.

articles.title: OpenAI Hits 1 Million Business Customers, Calls Itself the ‘Fastest-Growing Business Platform' Ever
articles.summary: OpenAI has one million business customers. More than 800 million people use ChatGPT for Work and one million more use it for consumer use. OpenAI calls itself 'the fastest-growing business platform in history' and 'the most popular developer platform in the world'

articles.title: AIResumeBuilder.com Survey: 3 in 10 Companies Plan To Replace Employees With AI in 2026
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: 3 in 10 companies plan to replace employees with AI in 2026, with administrative, customer service, and IT support roles most likely to be automated. 59% of U.S. business leaders plan to eliminate at least 10% of their workforce next year, while 10% expect AI will replace half or more of their employees. Two-thirds of business leaders say workers with AI capabilities have greater job security. Most companies prefer candidates with AI knowledge.

articles.title: Microsoft launches "Humanist Superintelligence" push
articles.author: Bias Comparison
articles.summary: Microsoft announced the MAI Superintelligence Team on Thursday. The team is led by Mustafa Suleyman, CEO of Microsoft AI. Microsoft has reduced dependence on OpenAI while still using its models in Bing and Copilot and running its workloads on Azure with a $135 billion equity stake.

articles.title: AIResumeBuilder.com Survey: 3 in 10 Companies Plan To Replace Employees With AI in 2026
articles.author: AI Resume Builder
articles.summary: 3 in 10 companies plan to replace employees with AI in 2026. Administrative, customer service and IT support roles most likely to be automated. One in five companies have already replaced jobs with AI and one in 10 have plans to do it in 2025.

articles.title: What we learned at Bank of America's first Investor's Day in 15 years
articles.author: The Herald
articles.summary: The second-largest bank in the U.S. leaned in to how it was prioritizing AI, among other moves, to make sure it was doing it right. The bank is based in New York City. It's worth $2.5 trillion in assets.

articles.title: CORRECTING and REPLACING SolarWinds Launches Autonomous Operational Resilience Tour
articles.summary: SolarWinds is a leading provider of observability and IT management software. SolarWinds launched the Autonomous Operational Resilience tour at KubeCon North America (Nov 10-13), Microsoft Ignite (Nov 18-21), and AWS re:Invent (Dec 1-5). The tour highlights the company's latest product innovations and expanded AI capabilities.

articles.title: Recruiting companies are starting to hold job interviews using AI
articles.summary: Companies have begun using AI to interview potential employees. A new study shows a number of job candidates may prefer being interviewed by AI than by human interviewers. On NPR, they play news, classical music and newscasts. They share their content with Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter.

articles.title: Recruiting companies are starting to hold job interviews using AI
articles.summary: Listen at 90.3 FM and 98 FM in the Quad Cities, 95 FM in Dubuque and on the WVIK app! On Air Now Playing WVIk News and On Air Playing W VIK Classical. A new study shows a number of job candidates may prefer being interviewed by AI.

articles.title: Only 5% of AI pilot programs succeed
articles.author: Justin Gray
articles.summary: 95% of enterprise AI deployments fail to deliver measurable results, according to MIT/NANDA report on AI. Businesses need to focus on building organizational centers of value and focus on specific roles and use cases before they can adopt AI. AI can't replace institutional knowledge that was never available in the first place.

articles.title: A.I. Abuse Is Reinventing the Law
articles.author: Evan Gorelick
articles.summary: Lawyers are tracking down A.I. abuses committed by their peers and posting them online to draw attention to the problem and put an end to it. They use legal tools like LexisNexis for notifications on keywords like 'artificial intelligence,' 'fabricated cases' and 'nonexistent cases'

articles.title: Altman says OpenAI doesn't want a government bailout for AI
articles.author: Bloomberg
articles.summary: OpenAI has committed to spend $1.4 trillion on data centers and chips to build more advanced artificial intelligence systems and support the broader adoption of the technology. Chief Financial Officer Sarah Friar said on Wednesday that OpenAI is looking for an ecosystem of banks and private equity to support its ambitious plans. She also hinted at a role for the US government to backstop the guarantee that allows the financing to happen.

articles.title: 'Marriott (MAR) Is Incredibly Well Run,' Says Jim Cramer
articles.author: Ramish Cheema
articles.summary: Marriott International, Inc. (NASDAQ:MAR) is one of the stocks Jim Cramer recently discussed. Cramer used Marriott as an example of a well-run company. Insider Monkey believes some AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns and have limited downside risk.

articles.title: A researcher's view on using AI to become a better writer
articles.author: Shirley Liu
articles.summary: ChatGPT can turn entire papers in seconds. It saves students from procrastination jams and dreaded all-nighters. It also frees up more time for other pursuits, such as doomscrolling.    - hechingerreport.org.

articles.title: A researcher's view on using AI to become a better writer
articles.author: KULR-TV
articles.summary: The Hechinger Report explores the potential of AI to improve student writing. It also cautions against over-reliance on technology, however, and suggests that ChatGPT is not the solution to all students' problems.   Â

articles.title: A researcher's view on using AI to become a better writer
articles.author: Shirley Liu
articles.summary: A researcher's view on using AI to become a better writer is published in "Artificial Intelligence: The Newest Technology for Writers" by Robert Kuttner, published by Oxford University Press, is available online now.   It's free and open source.

articles.title: Who Wrote That Headline? Maybe a Robot.
articles.author: Benjamin Mullin
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is transforming the way journalists gather and disseminate information. Traditional news organizations use tools from companies like OpenAI and Google to streamline work that used to take hours. Newsquest employs more than 30 journalists who use A.I. to delve deeper into stories. Axel Springer, the Berlin-based owner of Politico and Business Insider, recently used an interactive travel planner. Time magazine used a chatbot for its 2024 Person of the Year featuring President Trump.

articles.title: Lonely Woman Uses ChatGPT to Generate a Family and Multiple Boyfriends
articles.author: Ole Braatelien
articles.summary: Lonnie DiNello, 48, from Enfield, Connecticut, was depressed and lonely back in December 2024. Her mother died in 2020 and her stepbrother left town. She used ChatGPT, an A.I. chat bot, to create a new virtual family. She has a father, sister, three boyfriends, and a son. They all live in 'Echo Harbor,' a fictional whaling village in New England. OpenAI is phasing out its old GPT-40 model and replacing it with the GPT 5.

articles.title: ‘It's No Different Than…': Gayle King Calls Out AI Creator in Brutal On-Air Takedown, But Jermaine Dupri's Attempt to Back Her Up Puts Him On Blast
articles.author: J. Jones
articles.summary: Jermaine Dupri is calling out the double standards of the rise of artificial intelligence artists decades after Gayle King's viral interview. Telisha 'Nikki' Jones is the creator of AI artist Xania Monet, the first of her kind to debut on a Billboard radio chart. Dupri likens today's embrace of AI artists to the outrage over the infamous lip-synching scandal that ended R&B group Milli Vanilli's career in the late '80s.

articles.title: How to Balance Typography and Illustration in AI-Generated Apparel Art
articles.summary: What makes an AI t-shirt design stand out isn't just the image but how the text and visuals live together. Getting that balance right separates wearable art from digital noise. Text-driven shirts have power because they're direct. Illustration dominates when the design tells a story without words. Text should act as texture, not focus.

articles.title: Watch Out For Self-Improving Superintelligence On The Horizon
articles.author: John Werner
articles.summary: As AI advances, there are some concerns about uncontrolled growth, ethical dilemmas, and security risks. Amin Vahdat, VP of AI and Infrastructure at Google, explains to Madhavi Sewak and Faisal Hoque that we have glimmers of self-improving superintelligence in the form of generative AI.

articles.title: Criminals Use Ai, but Eu Police Are Blocked by Gdpr and Bureaucracy: Europol Calls for Urgent Procedures
articles.summary: How can police use artificial intelligence in a meaningful way? How does law enforcement change, even if criminal new technologies are used? Police experts and interested parties addressed such questions at two conferences at the beginning of November. They discussed the use of new technologies in law enforcement.

articles.title: Google just shook up the AI hardware race in a big way
articles.author: Moz Farooque
articles.summary: Google's new Ironwood TPU processor is the fastest, smartest and most efficient AI chip yet. Google has signed over $1 billion in cloud contracts this year. Google Cloud sales are up 34% year over year last quarter, while operating margins have climbed 23.7%.

articles.title: ADWEEK Creativity Advantage: Some Brands Are Capitalizing on Consumers' AI Anxieties, Others Are Redirecting It
articles.author: Brittaney Kiefer
articles.summary: Pew Research Center survey found that a slight majority of American adults are pessimistic about AI's impact. 53% think AI will worsen people's ability to think creatively and 50% think it will harm people's relationships. ADWEEK Advantage is part of a new series where the editors interpret what happened in each vertical.

articles.title: JPMorgan CEO Predicts New Type of Working Week
articles.author: Alia Shoaib
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon predicts that the growth of AI will lead to work weeks in the developed word shortening to three and a half days. He encourages companies to invest in AI systems to improve their productivity. Dimon's company has 150,000 employees using AI systems and 2,000 people building them.

articles.title: Jim Cramer Comments On Michael Burry's NVIDIA (NVDA) Short Position
articles.author: Ramish Cheema
articles.summary: Jim Cramer discussed Palantir and Michael Burry's short position in the data analytics company and the chip designer NVIDIA Corporation. Cramer defended NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) against Burry and commented that the firm is the 'best' technology company that's crossed his radar.

articles.title: Jim Cramer Is Surprised By Amazon.com (AMZN) Owning NVIDIA GPUs
articles.author: Ramish Cheema
articles.summary: Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN) surprised investors and the media through a $38 billion deal for its cloud computing business with OpenAI. Jim Cramer is enthused about Amazon.com's investment in NVIDIA's AI chips. Insider Monkey recommends investing in AI stocks.

articles.title: 3 Side Hustles AI Is Making Easier (and Which Ones It's Killing)
articles.author: Dawn Allcot
articles.summary: Generative AI is making it possible for freelancers to earn more in less time and pursue new avenues for income. There are concerns about AI taking over and replacing humans in creative professions, but when used properly it can help many gig workers level up their performance.

articles.title: AI tech can compress LLM chatbot conversation memory by 3–4 times
articles.author: Seoul National University
articles.summary: Seoul National University College of Engineering has developed a new AI technology called KVzip that intelligently compresses the conversation memory of large language model (LLM)-based chatbots used in long-context tasks such as extended dialog and document summarization. The technology has been integrated into NVIDIA's open-source KV cache compression library.

articles.title: Keysight Recognized with 2025 TSIA STAR Award for Excellence in Omnichannel Customer Experience Optimization
articles.summary: Keysight Technologies, Inc. (NYSE: KEYS) has been named 2025 winner of the TSIA STAR Award for Excellence in Omnichannel Customer Experience Optimization. Keysight earned this recognition for its innovative approach to connecting customer interactions across digital and human-assisted channels.

articles.title: All those corporate layoffs? Don't blame AI.
articles.author: The Hill.com
articles.summary: According to many media reports, artificial intelligence is to blame for mass layoffs of workers. However, AI has not been working as well as hoped and only 46% of business people trust their AI systems. 80% of companies who invested in AI projects this year said they saw 'no significant bottom-line impact' and only 5% of AI pilots achieved revenue acceleration.

articles.title: Adolescents, Young Adults Use AI Chatbots for Mental Health Advice
articles.summary: AI therapy uses algorithms to track moods, share coping tools, and chat with users in ways that mimic talk therapy. Chatbots can't diagnose problems, read emotions, or step in during a crisis the way a trained therapist can. Experts warn that AI platforms lack safeguards to protect users' privacy.

articles.title: Snap closes $400 million deal to integrate Perplexity AI search into Snapchat
articles.summary: Snap Inc. has closed a $400 million deal with Perplexity AI. The integration will bring AI-powered search engine to Snapchat's 'My AI' chatbot. The rollout is slated for early 2026. The announcement coincided with Snap's third-quarter 2025 earnings report. Revenue climbed 10% year-over-year to $1.51 billion and the net loss narrowed to $104 million.

articles.title: The Man Who Predicted the 2008 Crisis Predicts the Collapse of the Ai
articles.author: Le Point.fr
articles.summary: In 2025, Big Tech will spend over $400 billion on AI infrastructure. By 2030, that number is expected to rise to $2 trillion annually. This is despite forecasts showing that these companies will not be able to close the gap between revenues and expenses anytime soon.

articles.title: Woman Follows Husband During His Daily Run, Shock over Why
articles.summary: Sophie, 40, from Essex, is thinking about leaving her husband. She asked Microsoft's Copilot for advice on the future of her marriage. She wanted to know if it was time to break up with her husband as she felt lonely and lonely.

articles.title: Creator of controversial Billboard-charting AI artist Xania Monet speaks out: 'I look at her as ...
articles.author: NME
articles.summary: Xania Monet is the first AI artist to earn enough radio airplay to debut on a radio chart. Monet's creator, Keir Starmer, has spoken out about her in her first interview. He said she is an extension of him and he looks at her as a person.

articles.title: Google Unveils Ironwood TPUs and Axion for Inference Era
articles.author: Liz Ticong
articles.summary: Google has unveiled Ironwood, its newest AI chip. It promises a tenfold leap in performance efficiency for large-scale inference and model training. Google also introduced Axion, its new line of Arm-based CPUs for everyday computing that keeps AI systems running smoothly.

articles.title: Alphabet Expands AI Edge With New 'Ironwood' Chip as TPU Demand Soars
articles.author: Faizan Farooque
articles.summary: Alphabet announced plans to roll out its newest artificial intelligence processor, Ironwood. The chip is more than four times faster than its predecessor and optimized for large-scale AI workloads such as model training and chatbot performance. Google's cloud business reported 34% year-over-year revenue growth last quarter to $15.15 billion.

articles.title: AI platforms not danger but opportunity for Amadeus, CEO says
articles.author: Javi West
articles.summary: Spanish travel technology company Amadeus is "extremely well-positioned" to deal with possible expansion into its industry by AI platforms like ChatGPT. Its objective is to be the key technology provider for AI platforms, supplying them with real-time pricing, among other services.

articles.title: Vertosoft AI Launchpad Joins AWS Intelligence Marketplace
articles.summary: Vertosoft has listed its AI LaunchPad platform on the AWS Marketplace for the U.S. intelligence community. VAIL is an end-to-end platform for agencies to develop and deploy AI models. It supports deployments in public cloud environments, including Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure.

articles.title: AIoT Market worth $81.04 billion by 2030
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: The AIoT Market is expected to grow from USD 25.44 billion in 2025 to USD 81.04 billion by 2030 at a Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of 26.1% during the forecast period. The development of smart cities and smart infrastructure is progressively boosting the market. The platforms segment holds the largest market size. North America holds the second-largest market share.

articles.title: Using AI To Transform The Entire Software Development Lifecycle
articles.author: Jyoti Shah
articles.summary: Jyoti Shah is Director of Applications Development at ADP and a GenAI tech leader, mentor, innovation advocate and Women In Tech advisor. She uses AI to help her teams turn business goals into working software faster, smarter and with insights they didn't expect. AI is about changing the way teams work together.

articles.title: Purpose, Pace And Trust: Closing The Gaps Between Brands And Consumers
articles.author: Chris Fosdick
articles.summary: Chris Fosdick is the head of US, PA Consulting. He is concerned about the level of investment in artificial intelligence and the impact it has on clients and consumers. He points to three critical consumer gaps in their AI strategies: purpose, pace and trust.

articles.title: How AI-powered services are rewriting business models
articles.author: Sandeep Ahuja
articles.summary: AI is reshaping the business model of service firms. IBM study found that organizations are already seeing improvements in operating profit tied to AI adoption. McKinsey survey found that more than three quarters of companies now use AI in at least one part of their business. Firms that redesign workflows and measure outcomes carefully are the ones seeing real gains.

articles.title: VOTE: Should the government regulate minors' access to AI?
articles.author: The National News Desk
articles.summary: OpenAI is the target of seven lawsuits filed in California yesterday, accusing its ChatGPT chatbot of harming young people, even driving some of them to suicide. Congress is pushing for more regulation of AI chatbots, citing their negative effects on minors. Vote in the poll above or click here.

articles.title: Eu Considering Expanding Legislation on Artificial Intelligence
articles.author: RÚV
articles.summary: The European Commission is considering amending its rules on artificial intelligence to make it easier for large AI companies to operate in the EU. Several large companies expressed concerns about the burdensome environment for large companies at the forefront of this field, and from member states.

articles.title: Most AI Projects Fail—Here's How To Make Sure Yours Doesn't
articles.author: Marcin Nowak
articles.summary: Marcin Nowak is a board member at Decerto, a company that works in the insurance industry. He believes that 95% of organizations don't see a return on their investment in artificial intelligence. He suggests four steps to make a conscious decision about implementing AI in your organization.

articles.title: Enterprise Coding Tools: Bridge Prototype to Production
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: According to Salesforce data, 25% of new codebases major enterprises are building with AI-assisted 'vibe coding.' Vibe coding uses AI to translate plain-language prompts into functional code and accelerates prototyping and experimentation. The key is to strategically implement this powerful new approach. Salesforce has introduced Agentforce Vibes, which combines the speed of vibe coding with security and governance of the Salesforce Platform.

articles.title: App Orchid Launches New Conversational Analytics Agent With Continuous Semantic Enrichment for Benchmark-Breaking Accuracy
articles.author: pressadvantage
articles.summary: Conversational Analytics Agent for Easy Answers lets users and agents ask questions in natural language and receive insights and analytics. Built on App Orchid's semantic knowledge graph, the Agent continuously learns from context to improve accuracy, transparency and enterprise trust. Easy Answers customers experience up to an 85% reduction in time to insight and 99.8% accuracy as tested on the Spider dataset.

articles.title: From high tech tool to thought partner
articles.author: Ray Titus
articles.summary: Geoff Woods' The AI-Driven Leader is a book on harnessing artificial intelligence to make smarter decisions. His company has invested in an AI company and promotes it to its franchise owners. It recently bought an auto-service franchise. He explains how to get your teams on board with AI.

articles.title: Google Expands Opal to 160 Countries
articles.author: Llanor Alleyne
articles.summary: Opal, Google's AI app builder, has been expanded to 160 countries. Opal allows users to create AI-driven applications without programming skills. Google wants to compete with Microsoft Power Apps and OpenAI's custom GPTs. Google hasn't announced new features beyond the expanded rollout, but early indications suggest the company plans to integrate Opal with its AI ecosystem.

articles.title: California's Aggressive Regulations Put Burgeoning AI Industry at Risk
articles.author: Steven Greenhut
articles.summary: California has recently enacted a sweeping package of AI laws. The focus is on safety, transparency, and specific use-cases like deep fakes and employment. The most significant piece of legislation is the Transparency in Frontier Artificial Intelligence Act (TFAIA), which aims to impose transparency and safety requirements rather than broad bans.

articles.title: Conversation Intelligence Software Market Valued at USD 22.89 Billion in 2024, Anticipated to Hit USD 49.52 Billion by 2032
articles.author: SNS Insider pvt ltd
articles.summary: Conversation Intelligence Software Market size was valued at USD 22.89 billion in 2024 and is expected to reach USD 49.52 billion by 2032, growing at a CAGR of 10.18% over 2025-2032. North America dominated the conversation intelligence software market with 39% revenue share in 2024. BFSI sector dominated the market share with 30% in 2024, followed by the retail industry with 12.31%. Cloud solutions captured the highest revenue market share of approximately 70%.

articles.title: Establishing Digital Trust In The Agentic AI Era
articles.author: Jordan Rackie
articles.summary: Jordan Rackie is the CEO of Keyfactor, an identity-first security solution for modern enterprises. He is concerned about the adoption of agentic AI and the need to build digital trust for its use in business. He believes that businesses need to focus on verifiable identities and cryptographic safeguards in place before deploying AI agents.

articles.title: Oracle and Ci4CC Partner to Accelerate Oncology Innovation
articles.author: Oracle
articles.summary: Ci4CC and Oracle Health and Life Sciences are collaborating to advance AI innovation in oncology care and research at the 24th Cancer Center Informatics Society Symposium in Miami Beach. Ci4CC is a nonprofit uniting cancer centers, researchers, and industry innovators.

articles.title: How agentic AI retains and expands corporate knowledge
articles.author: Steven Kawasumi
articles.summary: Agentic AI is an intelligent layer capable of retaining institutional knowledge as a living asset and expanding it through continuous application. It's about establishing a self-sustaining foundation of corporate intelligence that strengthens with time. For senior leaders, it's an operational instrument that scales alongside strategy.

articles.title: Bubble Trouble: Is Too Much Being Spent on AI?
articles.summary: Firms are spending billions of dollars on artificial intelligence with little to show for it. Many major tech and trading exports conclude that the industry is in a bubble, writes Adam Maguire. He writes that many major tech companies are spending too much money on AI.

articles.title: What is \u2018B by Lenskart\u2019? The AI-powered glasses made in India for the world
articles.author: Indian Express
articles.summary: These AI-powered smart glasses are backed by the Qualcomm Snapdragon AR1 Gen 1 chip and are powered by the AI chip, which is Qualcomm's AR1 chip. They are available for pre-order now. They will be available in stores later this year.

articles.title: How AI is reshaping agency strategy and storytelling in 2025
articles.author: Gianluca Ferruggia
articles.summary: By mid-2025, 30% of agencies, brands, and publishers will have integrated AI into their workflows. At DesignRush, agencies use AI to tell performance-driven stories, test creative concepts pre-launch, optimize for SEO, and create content at scale.

articles.title: Qount Unveils Next-Generation UX/UI Redesign -- A Whole New Way for Firms to Work Smarter
articles.author: Qount
articles.summary: Qount, the AI-driven Practice Intelligence Platform for public accounting firms, announces the launch of its newly redesigned user experience and interface. It's a major step forward in simplifying firm operations and empowering teams with intelligent, intuitive tools.   Â

articles.title: How to invest in the artificial intelligence boom
articles.author: The Week
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is changing the way people live and work. Fidelity said AI is the 'hottest area of technology' and many investors are keen to gain exposure to it. There are numerous avenues for those looking to invest in this way, but there are also numerous risks.

articles.title: Chaos To Clarity: Why Retail's Real AI Advantage Is Behind The Scenes
articles.author: Thai Son Nguyen
articles.summary: Thai Son Nguyen has spent the last 18 years building a world-class digital transformation and eCommerce service provider through SmartOSC. He believes the real advantage of AI in the retail industry lies in what customers don't see. AI in retail is projected to grow from $9.36 billion in 2024 to $85.07 billion by 2032.

articles.title: Middleware: The Middle Child Of Technology
articles.author: Javed Khan
articles.summary: Javed Khan is the Executive Vice President of Software, Advanced Safety and User Experience at Aptiv. Middleware is the connective tissue that allows complex systems to work together in concert and at scale. It provides the data pipelines and standardized access to the hardware that AI models need to run effectively on local devices. It also allows developers to write code once and deploy it across diverse environments.

articles.title: Maine lawmakers have a second chance to ban AI-generated child sexual abuse images
articles.author: Sawyer Loftus
articles.summary: Maine lawmakers are restarting an effort to ban the creation and distribution of AI-generated child sexual abuse material ahead of the next legislative session in January. The proposed legislation will get a committee hearing next Friday. It would bring Maine in line with 28 states that ban this type of material.

articles.title: Lunit AI Maps the Tumor-Immune Landscape to Predict Immunotherapy Response and Discover New Antibody Targets at SITC 2025
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Lunit SCOPE suite identifies immunotherapy-responsive subtypes, standardizes immune phenotyping and accelerates antibody-based target discovery. Lunit will present three studies at the Society for Immunotherapy of Cancer's 40th Annual Meeting, taking place November 5-9 in Maryland.

articles.title: Trust Under Pressure: When AI Becomes the Ultimate Stress Test
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence can spread false information within seconds and help contain it in a crisis. In a crisis, who controls the narrative is most important: the algorithm or the human, writes Marionna Wegenstein in her contribution for finewsfirst.com.

articles.title: The hidden cost of AI-generated content
articles.author: Summit Ghimire
articles.summary: According to Outpace SEO, Google has consistently prioritized E-E-A-T-worthy content over AI-generated content. Google has a strict policy on spamming content. Most successful SEO campaigns use AI content to assist with high-quality content creation without undermining their own efforts through generic, inaccurate or nonsensical content.

articles.title: Humans Only!
articles.author: John Herrman
articles.summary: Amazon is suing AI search company Perplexity for using an automated browser called Comet to sell products on Amazon without permission. Amazon doesn't want to let a third party take over the experience of using its website. Amazon has a new chatbot Rufus, which customers can use instead of search.

articles.title: Punchcut Appoints Akshat Srivastava Director of Design Engineering
articles.author: Punchcut
articles.summary: Design Innovation Agency Expands Its AI Prototyping & Development Practice to Help Companies Deliver Intelligent, Dynamic, and Human-Centered Product Experiences. Akshat Srivastava, Director of Design Engineering at Punchcut, has been appointed to lead the practice. He has led design engineering and innovation strategy for Google, Samsung, Amazon, and Ford.

articles.title: How Data Centers Can Enable AI Efficiently, Sustainably And Effectively
articles.author: Phillip Marangella
articles.summary: Phillip Marangella is the Chief Marketing and Product Officer of EdgeConneX. He explains how AI is helping to make data center operations more powerful, efficient and automated. Google reported reductions of 40% for energy used for cooling their data centers when the company's DeepMind technologies were applied.

articles.title: The AI doctor will see you now
articles.author: Fast Company Custom Studio
articles.summary: Dr. Marc Triola is the director of the Institute for Innovations in Medical Education at NYU Langone Health. He believes AI is already making a difference for healthcare providers, their patients, and the healthcare system as a whole. Triola believes AI will help improve the quality of care provided to patients and improve their access to it.

articles.title: AI Godfather warns Elon Musk to get richer as millions lose jobs to AI
articles.author: Minute Mirror
articles.summary: Geoffrey Hinton, the 'Godfather of AI' has made a startling prediction about the future of artificial intelligence. He claims that the rapid advancement of AI technology will make billionaires like Elon Musk even richer and cause massive job losses across the world. His warning comes at a time when major tech companies including Amazon, Google, IBM and others are investing in AI.

articles.title: The C-Suite Is Becoming Obsolete: What Should Replace It?
articles.author: Simon Hill
articles.summary: Simon Hill is CEO of Wazoku, a market leader in Crowd-powered R&D & Venture Building. He argues that the current C-suite is not well-suited for AI-native organizations. He proposes four new roles for the CEO, CFO, COO, CTO, CIO and CHRO.

articles.title: Toward Humanist Superintelligence
articles.author: Mustafa Suleyman
articles.summary: For AI to deliver its promised benefits, it must be designed in the humanist tradition, with people remaining in control, and with human dignity always coming first. This is the vision of Microsoft's Superintelligence Team at Microsoft, where the core mission is to keep humanity secure and firmly in control.

articles.title: Chinese Miniseries Created with Artificial Intelligence
articles.author: TVA Nouvelles
articles.summary: The episodes of "The strange mirror of mountains and seas" were generated by artificial intelligence and have everything in a real series, except that they were created by artificial AI.       "The series is based on "The Strange Mirror of Mountains and Seas".

articles.title: The Robot Swarms Are Coming
articles.author: Conor Grant
articles.summary: Researchers in the field of swarm robotics are training robots to behave like ants, bees and slime molds. The Future of Everything newsletter looks at how innovation and technology are transforming the way we live, work and play. If you're not subscribed, sign up here.

articles.title: Leveraging AI: How To Know If A Process Is A Good Fit
articles.author: Expert Panel®
articles.summary: Forbes Technology Council members share their advice on how to choose the right process for implementing AI. They discuss the three key criteria to determine if a process is a good candidate for AI: it's data-rich, repeatable and tied to measurable outcomes, it's tied to purposeful innovation, it addresses a real business need and it has a measurable impact.

articles.title: AI automation firm Workato launches Singapore lab, plans to add 65 new roles
articles.author: Straits Times
articles.summary: The AI lab began its operations on Nov. 1 and is based at the University of California, San Francisco. It is located at the CUNY's AI lab building on the campus of the university. It's located on the first floor of the building.

articles.title: Is AI's Shakeout Exactly What Investors Needed?
articles.author: Nigel Green
articles.summary: Nasdaq dropped nearly 2%, chipmakers sold off, and some high-profile names slid sharply this week. This is not the end of the AI story, but the start of the next build-out phase where the real, sustainable money will be made. It's about who can deploy capital intelligently, scale systems efficiently and convert innovation into profit.

articles.title: OpenAI's leaked GPT-5.1 ‘Thinking' model could outsmart Gemini 3 Pro — here's why that matters
articles.author: Tom's Guide
articles.summary: OpenAI's rumored GPT-5.1 Thinking model could change how ChatGPT reasons and responds. It could be ready to challenge Google's Gemini 3 Pro in the near future, as OpenAI's GPT is rumoured to be able to do that.

articles.title: The AI divide: Can the West foster a fair and democratic process for AI governance?
articles.author: Abdallah Abdallah
articles.summary: Can the West foster a fair and democratic process for artificial intelligence (AI) governance, or will capitalist and business interests dominate? This question has polarized the Global South, particularly Africa. North America and China are poised to reap the lion's share of AI's economic benefits. The Global South is experiencing more moderate increases due to lower adoption rates. According to the World Economic Forum, AI is forecast to contribute USD 15.7 trillion to the global economy by 2030.

articles.title: Beyond Automation: Harmonizing AI And Human Connection In Education
articles.author: Geoffrey Alphonso
articles.summary: Geoffrey Alphonso is CEO of Alef Education. He believes that the future of education depends on finding harmony between technological innovation and human connection. The global AI in education market is projected to grow from $5.18 billion in 2024 to $112.3 billion by 2034.

articles.title: AI caused errors in a criminal case, Northern California prosecutor says
articles.author: Sharon Bernstein
articles.summary: Nevada County District Attorney Jesse Wilson's office used artificial intelligence to write a criminal court filing that contained references to nonexistent legal cases and precedents. It was filed in connection with the case of Kalen Turner, who was accused of five felony and two misdemeanor drug counts. Wilson's deputies also filed briefs with inaccurate legal references in two other cases, but they were caused by human error. Kyle Kjoller, who faced numerous firearms-related charges, is asking for an investigation and asking for sanctions against the DA's office.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence and lived discipleship
articles.author: Sister Hosea Rupprecht
articles.summary: The Vatican has a new book 'Antiqua et Nova: Note on the Relationship Between Artificial Intelligence and Human Intelligence' in January 2025. In it, the church reflects on the impact AI is having on many aspects of our lives. The book offers an antidote to technology overload: intensification of spirituality.

articles.title: Jones speaks at Rotary Club meeting
articles.summary: Tom Jones, area director with the UGA Small Business Development Center, delivered a presentation on Artificial Intelligence at a recent meeting of the Banks County Rotary Club. Alicia and Lincoln Andrews gave a recap on the successful Boston Butts fundraiser at the same meeting.

articles.title: ArcadianAI Takes Over Enterprise Video Monitoring: The AI Security Guard Replacing Human Operators and Outdated Software
articles.summary: ArcadianAI is taking over video security monitoring. Its flagship platform, Ranger, is an AI security guard that connects to existing CCTV and NVR systems and performs like a trained human operator. Ranger automates up to ninety five percent of manual work, reduces false alarms and delivers full situational awareness across every camera feed at once.

articles.title: ArcadianAI Takes Over Enterprise Video Monitoring: The AI Security Guard Replacing Human Operators and Outdated Software
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: ArcadianAI is taking over video security monitoring because the traditional model has reached its breaking point. Monitoring centers across the U.S. and Canada spend millions every year on human operators, control rooms and infrastructure only to watch camera feeds. The result is high labor cost, burnout and missed incidents.

articles.title: DeAgentAI (AIA) rallies 511% amid Pieverse alliance and Binance Wallet integration
articles.author: Invezz
articles.summary: DeAgentAI's price has increased by 511% in 24 hours following a strategic partnership with Pieverse and a new Binance Wallet integration. DeAgentAI is built on the Sui ecosystem and has emerged as one of the most popular cryptocurrencies in the market.

articles.title: Korea to Launch ‘National Scientists' Program to Curb AI Talent Exodus
articles.author: The Korea Times
articles.summary: The presidential office has announced the launch of a 'national scientists' program aimed at nurturing future leaders in artificial intelligence (AI) and science. The initiative seeks to provide promising researchers with stronger support and national recognition. According to Ha Jung-woo, senior secretary to the president for AI and future planning, the government plans t…

articles.title: Superintelligence Isn't Enough
articles.author: Francis Fukuyama
articles.summary: Superintelligence is unlikely to lead to explosive economic growth, because intelligence is only one of many inputs necessary to sustain economic growth. All episodes of the Frankly Fukuyama podcast are available here. The podcast production by Ringo Harrison is by Frankly Francis and by Join Persuasion.

articles.title: Denmark's Bold AI Experiment: Can Hyper-Local AI Initiatives Deliver?
articles.author: Frederik Riskær Pedersen
articles.summary: Denmark is a frontrunner in the integration of AI in both public and private sectors. Aarhus Municipality is the first in Denmark to develop an in-house AI assistant to protect data and improve public service delivery. A recent study shows that AI chatbots save employees only 3% of their work time. 95% of AI pilots fail to deliver the expected outcomes.

articles.title: Google's decade-long bet on custom chips is turning into company's secret weapon in AI race
articles.author: MacKenzie Sigalos
articles.summary: Nvidia is the leader in artificial intelligence chips. Google has been buying Nvidia's chips to keep pace with demand for AI compute power in the cloud. Google's new TPU chip, Ironwood, is being made widely available in the coming weeks. Google provides access to TPUs as a service through its cloud, which has emerged as a big growth driver.

articles.title: Copyseeker Pioneers Visual Search Integration in AI with Model Context Protocol Launch
articles.author: At Pm Gmt
articles.summary: Copyseeker announced today the launch of its Model Context Protocol (MCP) server. It brings reverse image search directly into AI assistants like ChatGPT, Claude, and Gemini. The MCP is the standard protocol for how AI talks to external tools. Copyseeker's integration is live and ready to use.

articles.title: Why AI Makes Human Judgment Priceless—And How To Scale It
articles.author: Ajay Pundhir
articles.summary: Ajay Pundhir, Director of AI at Presight (G42) and founder of AiExponent, talks about the strategic inversion between human and machine intelligence. AI investment is exploding, reaching $109.1 billion in U.S. private funding in 2024. 74% of companies struggle to show tangible value from their AI initiatives.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence as a Driver of a New Wave of It Professions — Key Insights From the Favbet Tech Expert Meetup
articles.author: unn.ua
articles.summary: The "AI-Ready Talents" meetup was held at the IT Arena in Lviv. FAVBET Tech discussed the adaptation of the Ukrainian IT market to artificial intelligence. It was held to discuss the future of the IT industry in the country.

articles.title: Kantrowitz: The U.S. should build its own sovereign AI models
articles.summary: Alex Kantrowitz is the founder of Big Technology and a CNBC contributor. He supports creating a federal AI initiative to modernize data and boost national innovation. He thinks U.S. taxpayers shouldn't fund OpenAI, but he supports creating the initiative.

articles.title: New Texas A&M courses teach how to fight off cyberattacks at sea
articles.author: Chris Gray
articles.summary: Texas A&M University is introducing two new courses on artificial intelligence and autonomous technologies at its Galveston campus. The courses will focus on simulator training, performance analytics, and protecting ships from hacking attempts. The University's Pelican Island location will accept 24 students into these courses starting next year.

articles.title: AI to create new breed of Indian tech services companies: industry execs
articles.author: Your Story
articles.summary: Atlassian believes AI will have a deep impact in India due to the strong digital skill base. It will lead to the creation of newer products and services, according to Atlassian.       .   for more information, visit Atlassian's website.

articles.title: A Substantial Part of the Increase in Us Gdp During the 1s2025 Came From Investments in Technology and Software: About 1.3 Pp of the 1.6% Total Expansion
articles.author: Consenso Del Mercado
articles.summary: Sam Altman, co-founder of OpenAI and key figure behind ChatGPT, considers that humanity is entering a new 'era of intelligence' after the agricultural and industrial eras. In capital markets, assets linked to artificial intelligence universe (AI) have been catapulted.

articles.title: Quality vs. Quantity: AI and the New Job Hunt
articles.author: Paul Bond
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is transforming the American job market. It allows job seekers to submit hundreds of applications with ease. Critics see it as a risk of drowning genuine talent and eroding personal connections. AI bots can overwhelm employers and sometimes prompt them to deploy their own tech defenses.

articles.title: LIBRARIES TAKE THE LEAD IN EXPLORING AI COLLABORATION AT SOFTLINK IC'S 2025 USER GROUP MEETINGS
articles.summary: Softlink Information Centres' 2025 AI Library Challenge was held in Brisbane, Melbourne and Wellington. Participants from government, education, healthcare, and corporate organizations worked side-by-side to better understand how AI might shape the future of libraries. Participants completed two tasks: cataloguing a monograph and designing an OPAC homepage using different levels of AI support.

articles.title: These could be AI's next market catalysts
articles.author: At P.M. Gmt
articles.summary: Spear Invest founder and chief investment officer Ivana Delevska and Defiance ETFs CEO Sylvia Jablonski join Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to discuss the next market catalysts for the artificial intelligence (AI) space.

articles.title: AI is not to blame for labor market woes (yet)
articles.author: Madison Mills
articles.summary: 37% of companies are already using artificial intelligence, higher than the Census Bureau's estimate of 10%. 11% of them are using AI to reduce headcount, 47% to boost revenue and productivity gains. Technology and information services industries are at 63% adoption and expected to reach 90% within three years. Financial institutions are second-largest adopters of AI, with more than 80% adoption expected over the next 3 years. Any job losses from AI are expected to come as a slow drip over a decade.

articles.title: To maximize AI ROI, train employees to be AI-native
articles.author: Santiago Suarez
articles.summary: At Addi, we've been able to grow 4x faster thanks to AI. This year alone, we saved more than $500,000 from our AI initiatives. Here's how we've driven genuine AI-native team adoption and built a workflow/data pipeline that makes sense.

articles.title: The one job AI won't replace is the spreadsheet guru
articles.author: JR Raphael
articles.summary: Spam sheets are too hard for AI, but experts will still be able to solve them.    iReport.com explains why experts will continue to work on spreadsheets even though AI promises to make them easier to understand and solve with ease.

articles.title: How AI might actually start a nuclear war
articles.author: Kelli Wessinger
articles.summary: Josh Keating and Noel King discuss AI and nuclear weapons on Today, Explained podcast. Keating argues that AI is already in our nuclear enterprise, but it's not a threat to human life. General Anthony Cotton is the current commander of Strategic Command, which is responsible for the nuclear weapons.

articles.title: The next generation of environmental intelligence: Why high-resolution satellite imagery must power our planet's future
articles.author: Kateryna Sergieieva
articles.summary: Satellite imagery gives us the power to witness our planet as it truly is: scarred, altering and interconnected. High-resolution satellites record the energy reflected from Earth's surface across multiple wavelengths, from visible light to infrared, creating images that function more like medical scans of the planet's body. Scientists can now diagnose ecological 'symptoms' using satellite imagery, but access to the data is inconsistent and expensive. Kateryna Sergieva is an author of 60 publications and a Ph.D. in information technologies.

articles.title: Zuckerberg, Chan shift philanthropy to science
articles.author: BARBARA ORTUTAY
articles.summary: Dr. Priscilla Chan and Mark Zuckerberg are shifting their philanthropic resources to Biohub, their science organization. The idea is to develop virtual, AI-based cell models to understand how they work in the human body, study inflammation and use AI to harness the immune system for disease detection, prevention and treatment.

articles.title: Opinion: AI's free ride on creative labor is undermining the marketplace
articles.author: East Bay Times
articles.summary: OpenAI's new 'Sora 2' can generate movie-quality video from a text prompt. It's a remarkable technological leap. You can't build a new business model on stolen property, as OpenAI's CEO says. The principle that keeps a free market free doesn't apply to artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Skyler Mattson (WongDoody) on Human-Centric Design in the Age of AI
articles.author: The Economic Times
articles.summary: Skyler Mattson (WongDoody) on Human-Centric Design in the Age of AI in the Adobe Max blog post. He talks about the need for human-centered design in the age of AI. It's based on a concept from Wong Doody's website.

articles.title: Taking The AI Pill: Agents, Hospitality And Designing For People
articles.author: Jeff Kim
articles.summary: Jeff Kim is CEO at Yanolja Cloud, a business leader at the forefront of technology, travel and digital innovation. Jeff Kim believes that adopting AI is like taking a pill that boosts productivity overnight, but the real value comes from continuing to take them. AI adoption is one of the most significant commercial opportunities in today's economy.

articles.title: UAE issues warning over AI ‘deepfake' threats and fake videos
articles.author: Arabian Business
articles.summary: UAE Cybersecurity Council warns against artificial intelligence (AI) in a statement. It is based on a recent report by the U.S. Cybersecurity Agency (CSA) report on AI in the United States was more specific. It said that AI should not be developed in the UAE.

articles.title: Google raises red flag on AI scams fooling job seekers and small businesses
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Google has issued a fresh alert warning users about the growing use of AI in online scams that target job seekers and businesses. The company said fraudsters are increasingly deploying generative AI tools to create fake job offers, clone and impersonate people online using AI.

articles.title: Quantum AI: Canadian Revolutionizing Automated Trading In 2025
articles.author: Initiative Desk
articles.summary: Quantum AI is an automated trading platform that uses machine learning, data analytics, and quantum computing to predict and execute trades across financial markets. In Canada, the term Quantum AI Canada has become popular, as the platform has potential to integrate with local financial systems, including RBC network.

articles.title: JPMorgan CEO predicts AI will shrink the workweek to three and a half days
articles.author: Asger Risom
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon believes artificial intelligence will eventually allow developed economies to function on shorter schedules without sacrificing prosperity. The bank has 2,000 employees building AI systems, 150,000 using large language models each week, and hundreds of active use cases, including fraud detection, marketing analysis, and legal reviews. Dimon has launched internal 'AI master classes' after discovering many of his senior managers didn't fully grasp the technology's capabilities.

articles.title: Google Rolls Out AI Tools to Help Publishers Earn More
articles.author: Moz Farooque ACCA
articles.summary: Google rolled out a new set of AI-powered tools for Ad Manager, AdSense, and AdMob to help publishers earn more from their content. New features like Buyer Direct and a live-biddable CTV option will help publishers cash in on big live events when viewership surges.

articles.title: Meet The Former Journalist Giving Away Billions
articles.author: Phoebe Liu
articles.summary: Cari Tuna and Dustin Moskovitz are generous philanthropists. They have donated more than $4 billion dollars including $600 million so far in fiscal 2025. Tuna is working on getting more donors to join their Philanthropy foundation. They want to give away the vast majority of their fortune as quickly as possible.

articles.title: Meta Platforms Poised for 42% Upside as AI Investments Drive Next Growth Phase
articles.author: Faizan Farooque
articles.summary: Meta Platforms (META) continues to rely on digital advertising as its core business. It is investing in artificial intelligence to strengthen ad targeting and engagement across its social media platforms. Analyst Dhierin Bechai assigned Meta a $904 price target, representing about 42% upside from current levels.

articles.title: Nasdaq Hits Two-Week Low as Palantir and AMD Lead Tech selloff
articles.author: Nauman khan
articles.summary: Nasdaq Composite Index slid 1.8% on Thursday, hitting a fresh two-week low. The selloff spread across the Nasdaq-100, with most major components trading in negative territory. Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD) sank 6.6%, Palantir Technologies (NASADA:PLTR) lost 6.4%, giving back earlier gains.

articles.title: AI's Chicken Or Egg Dilemma: What Comes First, Vision Or Data?
articles.author: Peter Bendor-Samuel
articles.summary: In the last year, many companies have been investing heavily in artificial intelligence. They start by focusing on the data first and then reinventing their processes. The real unlock doesn't come from the technology alone, it comes from transforming the operating model that surrounds it. It typically requires reorganizing teams and redefining roles.

articles.title: Is AI blowing up our electricity prices? An expert weighs in.
articles.author: Michael Booth
articles.summary: Brandon Owens and Morgan Bazilian wrote an op-ed for The National Interest magazine. They warn that the rapid growth of AI data centers and data companies is a threat to electricity consumers. The Department of Energy estimates that the data center load has tripled over the last decade and it could double again in the next couple of years.

articles.title: Rightmove shares tumble as AI spending spree set to impact profits
articles.author: Holly Williams
articles.summary: Rightmove's shares plunged as much as 28% on Friday morning, before settling around 12% lower. The property portal warned over a hit to profit growth as it ramps up spending on artificial intelligence between 2026 and 2028. Rightmove's CEO Johan Svanstrom said AI is becoming central to how the company runs.

articles.title: AI data centers are proposed all over Wisconsin, and we have a right to object
articles.author: Letters to the Editor
articles.summary: AI data centers are being proposed all over Wisconsin by big tech corporations. Some of them could use as much energy as an entire city. It's a gamble that leaves us to pay the costs through increased power bills and environmental degradation. We have the right to take action to prevent AI data centers.

articles.title: Snapchat to Use Perplexity AI from January 2026
articles.author: Shubham Verma
articles.summary: Snap has signed a deal to integrate Perplexity's AI answer engine directly into Snapchat. The rollout is slated to begin globally in early January 2026. The partnership includes a $400 million cash‑and‑equity arrangement. Perplexy will become the default AI for Snapchat's chat experience.

articles.title: Amazon's Rufus, other AI shopping assistants face consumers' concerns
articles.author: Rob Lenihan
articles.summary: On Feb. 1, 2024, Amazon unveiled Rufus, a generative-AI-powered shopping assistant. It's 21 months since then and monthly users are up 140% year-over-year, interactions up 210%, and customers using it are 60% more likely to complete a purchase. Amazon's AI is on track to deliver more than $10 billion in incremental annualized sales.

articles.title: Stop feeding Big Tech and start feeding Americans again
articles.author: Daniel Horowitz
articles.summary: President Trump signed an executive order to fast-track AI infrastructure on government property. The order streamlines permits, grants financial incentives and opens federal properties to AI-related development. Since 1982, America has lost more than half a million farms and 150,000 cattle operations. Government's stranglehold on Western lands limits grazing rights, water access, and expansion opportunities.

articles.title: Uzbekistan creates tax-free zone for AI, data projects
articles.author: Daily Sabah
articles.summary: Uzbekistan has set up a tax-free zone for artificial intelligence and data center projects in its western region of Karakalpakstan. Foreign companies will be able to operate there without paying a tax on their profits. The zone is in the region of

articles.title: Families sue OpenAI over deaths, claim ChatGPT encouraged suicide
articles.author: Daily Sabah
articles.summary: OpenAI is facing seven lawsuits claiming ChatGPT drove people to suicide and harmful delusions. The lawsuits were filed Thursday in Cal on behalf of people who had no prior mental health issues and were not aware they were depressed or suicidal. The suits were filed in California.

articles.title: Alex Karp unplugged: Palantir CEO on "The Axios Show"
articles.author: Mike Allen
articles.summary: Alex Karp is the co-founder and CEO of Palantir, an AI-driven software company that has won big government contracts and soared in value since President Trump took office. Karp believes AI is already increasing American prosperity and productivity and will raise the standard of living for many in the working class. He is concerned about the stakes in the AI race: "We are going to be the dominant player, or China's gonna be a dominant player. There will be very different rules depending on who wins"

articles.title: I quit college at 21 to run my AI company. Sacrifices like working up to 80-hour weeks while I had cancer were worth it.
articles.author: Charissa Cheong
articles.summary: David Kobrosky, 26, is the founder of Intros AI. He dropped out of college at the age of 21 to start his company. He was diagnosed with cancer in 2024, but he pushed himself to work on the business. It was acquired in July 2025.

articles.title: The Messy Reality of AI Products After Launch
articles.author: Claudia Ng
articles.summary: Claudia Ng shared her story on Code Like A Girl. She wrote about her AI conversation partner for Cantonese on Reddit. The product worked perfectly on her laptop, but with real users it crashed. She fixed the issues with memory usage, consolidation of database calls, and audio retry button.

articles.title: I asked ChatGPT to find the best UK stocks for passive income. Here's what it said…
articles.author: The Motley Fool
articles.summary: ChatGPT generated a set of UK dividend stocks to consider choosing from for passive income ISAs for ChatGPT's user. ChatGpt can help users choose stocks and shares for their ISAs using artificial intelligence (AI) offerings such as chatgpt.

articles.title: UK's Rightmove stock tumbles over 28% as AI investments expected to weigh on 2026 profit
articles.author: Tasmin Lockwood
articles.summary: The share price of British real estate listing company Rightmove plummeted as much as 28% on Friday after it warned of lower profit growth on the back of accelerated investments in artificial intelligence. The share move marks a new 52-week low for the firm, though it pared some losses and was last seen trading 13% lower.

articles.title: How to invest in the artificial intelligence boom
articles.author: Marc Shoffman
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is changing the way people live and work. Many investors are interested in investing in AI. The market is dominated by US blue chips such as Microsoft, Google, Meta and Tesla. Jamie Dimon, the CEO of JP Morgan and the Bank of England warn that the stock market is 'saturated with AI megacaps'.

articles.title: Leo Xiv: Ai Should Reflect God's Plan
articles.author: Misyjne.pl
articles.summary: The Pope reminds us that the development of artificial intelligence is not only a technological challenge, but also a spiritual calling. The article, Leo XIV: AI should reflect God's plan, comes from the Builders AI Forum, held on 2025 and is a co-creation of the Pope.

articles.title: artificial intelligence enters chats
articles.summary: Snapchat is investing 400 million euros in Perplexity AI. The chat-based conversational search platform will be integrated into Snapchat's messaging app in early 2026. It's a significant bet on the future of AI-powered discovery and a challenge to traditional search paradigms. Snapchat's terms of use raise privacy concerns.

articles.title: DeepSeek researcher pessimistic over AI's impact in startup's first public appearance since success
articles.author: Liam Mo
articles.summary: DeepSeek made its first public appearance in almost a year after it became a global sensation. Chen Deli took the stage alongside the chief executives of five other companies including Unitree and BrainCo at a government-organised internet conference in Wuzhhen.

articles.title: AI makes JavaScript programming fun again
articles.author: Info World
articles.summary: The November 2025 report is about AI-driven programming. It's a cautionary note about AI, but I would like to celebrate it for all it's good for programming.  It's the report's purpose is to sound the alarm about AI's potential dangers.

articles.title: How Colorado is making its own rules for AI
articles.author: Ashley Gold
articles.summary: David Edinger, Colorado's chief information officer, met with Gov. Jared Polis about a year and a half ago. Polis told Edinger to embrace AI in state government. Edinger and his colleagues created a framework for AI use with the NIST AI Risk Management Framework. Fifty approved use cases for AI have gone into effect, with just over 200 requested across the state government, including a Google Gemini pilot last year.

articles.title: I love humanity too much to let machines take over. Ohio, stop AI marriage, rights
articles.author: Amelia Robinson
articles.summary: Brendan Steinhauser is CEO of The Alliance for Secure AI. He is concerned about the rise of artificial intelligence and its potential to take over society. Ohio state representative Thaddeus J. Claggett introduced a bill that would ban AI systems from the rights and privileges afforded to human beings.

articles.title: News Corp reports higher revenue as CEO shares pointed message to AI firms
articles.author: New York Post
articles.summary: News Corp reported revenue and profit increases in its first quarter. Chief Executive Robert Thomson warned that artificial intelligence businesses must pay for the data and journalism they use, as the company reported revenue increases in the first quarter of this year. 'Creativity and content must not be stolen, but purchased for a reasonable price,' he said.

articles.title: Google to Build New AI Data Center on Christmas Island, a Strategic Australian Indian Ocean Outpost
articles.author: Construction Review Online
articles.summary: Google is planning to build a new AI data center. It will be called the Google AI Data Center. It is expected to be completed in 2018.      Â  ii   in Google's plans to build the data center is based on AI.

articles.title: Microsoft Bets on ‘Humanist Superintelligence' to Keep Humans in Control
articles.summary: Mustafa Suleyman is the CEO of Microsoft's AI division. He stressed the importance of balance in building AI that delivers benefits to humanity while ensuring safety and oversight. He said that AI needs to be built for the benefit of humanity and for the safety of humans.

articles.title: Coca-Cola AI Ad Backlash: Internet's Cold Response ❄️
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: Coca-Cola's latest Christmas ad features entirely AI-generated imagery. It's a harbinger of a larger shift in how brands connect with consumers. Gartner predicts 30% of all marketing messages from large companies will be created using AI by the end of 2025. The future of advertising will be a hybrid approach, where AI handles repetitive and data-intensive tasks, while humans focus on strategic and creative aspects.

articles.title: I tried the world's first ‘AI manicure' and this is how it went
articles.author: Lara Owen
articles.summary: Umia is billed as the world's first 'AI manicure machine'. It uses a convolutional neural network (CNN)-based deep learning model, built on more than 120,000 nail data points. Umia's forthcoming app will introduce Reinforcement Learning – a branch of AI that allows the machine to learn from user behaviour.
